attributes.action: The Travis Trust - Prenatal Screening for Spinal Muscular Atrophy
attributes.additional_details:
Spinal Muscular Atrophy Type 1 is the biggest genetic killer of babies under the age of 2. Currently there is no known cure.

Our beautiful baby boy passed away at 7 months old due to this cruel disease.

Although there is currently no treatment, or cure for SMA. Testing can be done at 12 weeks via CVS to determine if the baby has SMA, but currently its not on the list of prenatal tests.

This disease is devasting, for the families & most importantly the babies that it affects. Testing for Spinal Muscular Atrophy needs to be added to the prenatal tests done, so more babies and families do not have to go through the same things we did.
